Package presentation.fsa

Class Summary
ArrowHead A filled polygon in the shape of an arrowhead.
BezierEdge The graphical representation of a transition in a finite state automaton.
BezierEdgePlacer Algorithms for laying out a Bezier edge among a set of existing edges connecting the same pair of nodes.
BezierHandler A draggable representation of the control points and tangent lines for the bezier curve of an edge.
BezierLayout Graphical data and operations for visual display of a BezierEdge.
CircleNode The circular representation of a state in a finite state automaton.
CircleNodeLayout Graphical layout data required to display a circular node.
Edge The abstract description of data and behaviours common to all edges that represent transitions and initial arrows in the graphical display.
EdgeHandler Visual representation of the handles used to modify an edge.
EdgeLabellingDialog Dialog window for assigning multiple events from the global events model to transitions represented by an edge in the graph model.
EdgePopup A popup menu providing operations to modify or delete an edge.
FSAGraph A recursive structure used to view, draw and modify the graph representation of an Automaton.
GraphDrawingView The component in which users view, create and modify a graph representation of an automaton.
GraphElement The most generic implementation of elements displayed in a graphical view.
GraphExporter This class is charged with exporting the current graph (or a selection of that graph) to one of four formats: LaTex-PSTricks, EPS, GIF and PNG.
GraphExporter.ExportOptionsPane  
GraphLabel  
GraphView The visual display of an FSAGraph.
InitialArrow A visual representation of the arrow on a node indicating the initial state in a finite state machine.
Node The graphical representation of a state in a finite state automaton.
NodeLabellingDialog  
NodePopup  
ReflexiveEdge A symmetric self-loop manipulated by a single control point.
SelectionGroup  
SingleLineFreeLabellingDialog A dialog window for entering a single line of text and creating a free label (i.e.
SingleLineNodeLabellingDialog  
StateLabeler
